[常用复数][美国、加拿大英语]未婚（或单身）男子（或女子）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均可表示"唯一的"之意。
means: only ： 普通用词，常可与sole换用，但侧重仅限于指定的人或物，而不需要更多。
single ： 语气较强，强调仅此一个，再无第二个。
sole ： 语气强于only，指仅有一个或一群，只考虑这一个或这一群。
unique ： 非正式用词，侧重在一类中唯一无可匹敌、无与伦比的特征。
alone ： 着重专指某人或某物，而不是别的。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"未婚者，孤身一人"之意。
means: virgin ： 通常指未婚者，贞洁未被玷污的人，或指婚烟关系尚未完成者。
maiden ： 与virgin含义相近，但更着重年轻与未婚，或未曾发生过任何两性关系。
single ： 指尚未结婚的人，但更多指终生不结婚的人。

word_mean: single-mode laser 输出为单横模(一般为基模)、多纵模的激光器。
single-tube manometer 由一垂直管和与其连通并与其内径成一定比例的容器组成的液柱压力计。
single-frequency laser 输出为单横模(一般为基模)、单纵模的激光器。
single-focusing mass spectrometer 利用一块磁铁构成的磁分析器使速度(能量)相同而又有一定分散角度(方向)的离子束在直流磁场中作不同

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin singulus, related to simplus 'simple'

entry.def: You use single to emphasize that you are referring to one thing, and no more than one thing.

example.ex: Over six hundred people were wounded in a single day...
example.tran: 仅一天中就有 600 多人受伤。

entry.def: You use single to indicate that you are considering something on its own and separately from other things like it.

example.ex: Every single house in town had been damaged...
example.tran: 镇上每栋房子都遭到了破坏。

example.ex: The Middle East is the world's single most important source of oil.
example.tran: 中东是世界上最为重要的一个产油地。

entry.def: Someone who is single is not married. You can also use single to describe someone who does not have a girlfriend or boyfriend.

example.ex: Is it difficult being a single mother?...
I now have to face the rest of my life as a single person...
example.tran: 我现在不得不孤单一人度过余生。

entry.def: A single room is a room intended for one person to stay or live in.

example.ex: A single room at the Astir Hotel costs £56 a night.
example.tran: 阿斯蒂尔酒店的单人间价格是 56 英镑一晚。

entry.def: A single bed is wide enough for one person to sleep in.
A single ticket is a ticket for a journey from one place to another but not back again.

example.ex: The price of a single ticket is thirty-nine pounds.
example.tran: 单程票的价格是 39 英镑。

entry.tran: (只录几首短歌的)单曲唱片;(激光唱片上的)主打歌曲，单曲
entry.def: A single or a CD single is a CD which has a few short songs on it. You can also refer to the main song on a CD as a single .

example.tran: 现在的孩子都不买单曲唱片了。

example.ex: The winners will get a chance to release their own single.
example.tran: 获胜者将有机会发行自己的单曲唱片。

entry.def: Singles is a game of tennis or badminton in which one player plays another. The plural singles can be used to refer to one or more of these matches.

example.ex: Boris Becker of Germany won the men's singles...
example.tran: 德国的鲍里斯·贝克尔赢得男单冠军。

example.ex: She is equally at home on the singles or doubles court.
example.tran: 她单打和双打都能得心应手。

entry.tran: (板球中的)一分打;(棒球中的)一垒打
entry.def: In cricket, a single is a hit from which one run is scored. In baseball, a single is a hit by which a batter reaches first base.

means.word_mean: 1. a base hit on which the batter stops safely at first base
2. the smallest whole number or a numeral representing this number;

sentences.sentence: "he has the one but will need a two and three to go with it"

means.word_mean: 1. hit a one-base hit
1. existing alone or consisting of one entity or part or aspect or individual;

sentences.sentence: "upon the hill stood a single tower"
"had but a single thought which was to escape"

means.word_mean: 2. used of flowers having usually only one row or whorl of petals;

sentences.sentence: "single chrysanthemums resemble daisies and may have more than one row of petals"

means.word_mean: 3. not married or related to the unmarried state;
4. characteristic of or meant for a single person or thing;
5. having uniform application;
6. not divided among or brought to bear on more than one object or objective;

sentences.sentence: "judging a contest with a single eye"

means.word_mean: 7. involved two individuals;
8. individual and distinct;

sentences.sentence: "pegged down each separate branch to the earth"

Sentence.sentence: They needn't pay a single cent for their power consumption on sunny days.
high schools was made this year, as in years past, according to a single metric, the proportion of students taking college-level exams.
There are now growing numbers of people who live alone, single parents and children, and double-income families
But he hasn't gone through a single meeting, has he?
For example, in 1909 anyone who wanted to make a single copy of a literary work for personal use had to do so by hand
The origins, though not the cause of Ebola-Sudan, can be traced back to a single individual in a Sudanese town.
